00001 #ifndef __TIDY_BUFFIO_H__
00002 #define __TIDY_BUFFIO_H__
00003 
00004 /** @file buffio.h - Treat buffer as an I/O stream.
00005 
00006   (c) 1998-2007 (W3C) MIT, ERCIM, Keio University
00007   See tidy.h for the copyright notice.
00008 
00009   CVS Info :
00010 
00011     $Author: arnaud02 $ 
00012     $Date: 2007/01/23 11:17:45 $ 
00013     $Revision: 1.9 $ 
00014 
00015   Requires buffer to automatically grow as bytes are added.
00016   Must keep track of current read and write points.
00017 
00018 */
00019 
00020 #include "platform.h"
00021 #include "tidy.h"
00022 
00023 #ifdef __cplusplus
00024 extern "C" {
00025 #endif
00026 
00027 /** TidyBuffer - A chunk of memory */
00028 TIDY_STRUCT
00029 struct _TidyBuffer 
00030 {
00031     TidyAllocator* allocator;  /**< Memory allocator */
00032     byte* bp;           /**< Pointer to bytes */
00033     uint  size;         /**< # bytes currently in use */
00034     uint  allocated;    /**< # bytes allocated */ 
00035     uint  next;         /**< Offset of current input position */
00036 };
00037 
00038 /** Create (zeroed-out) data structure */
00039 TIDY_EXPORT TidyBuffer* TIDY_CALL tidyBufCreate( TidyAllocator* allocator ); /* [i_a] */
00040 
00041 /** Destroy data structure created with tidyBufCreate(). */
00042 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyBufDestroy( TidyBuffer* buf ); /* [i_a] */
00043 
00044 /** Initialize data structure using the default allocator */
00045 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyBufInit( TidyBuffer* buf );
00046 
00047 /** Initialize data structure using the given custom allocator */
00048 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyBufInitWithAllocator( TidyBuffer* buf, TidyAllocator* allocator );
00049 
00050 /** Free current buffer, allocate given amount, reset input pointer,
00051     use the default allocator */
00052 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyBufAlloc( TidyBuffer* buf, uint allocSize );
00053 
00054 /** Free current buffer, allocate given amount, reset input pointer,
00055     use the given custom allocator */
00056 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyBufAllocWithAllocator( TidyBuffer* buf,
00057                                                       TidyAllocator* allocator,
00058                                                       uint allocSize );
00059 
00060 /** Expand buffer to given size. 
00061 **  Chunk size is minimum growth. Pass 0 for default of 256 bytes.
00062 */
00063 TIDY_EXPORT Bool TIDY_CALL tidyBufCheckAlloc( TidyBuffer* buf,
00064                                               uint allocSize, uint chunkSize ); /* [i_a] */
00065 
00066 /** Free current contents and zero out */
00067 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyBufFree( TidyBuffer* buf );
00068 
00069 /** Set buffer bytes to 0 */
00070 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyBufClear( TidyBuffer* buf );
00071 
00072 /** Attach to existing buffer */
00073 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyBufAttach( TidyBuffer* buf, byte* bp, uint size );
00074 
00075 /** Detach from buffer.  Caller must free. */
00076 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyBufDetach( TidyBuffer* buf );
00077 
00078 
00079 /** Append bytes to buffer.  Expand if necessary. */
00080 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyBufAppend( TidyBuffer* buf, const void* vp, uint size );
00081 
00082 /** Append one byte to buffer.  Expand if necessary. */
00083 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyBufPutByte( TidyBuffer* buf, byte bv );
00084 
00085 /** Get byte from end of buffer */
00086 TIDY_EXPORT int TIDY_CALL  tidyBufPopByte( TidyBuffer* buf );
00087 
00088 
00089 /** Get byte from front of buffer.  Increment input offset. */
00090 TIDY_EXPORT int TIDY_CALL  tidyBufGetByte( TidyBuffer* buf );
00091 
00092 /** At end of buffer? */
00093 TIDY_EXPORT Bool TIDY_CALL tidyBufEndOfInput( TidyBuffer* buf );
00094 
00095 /** Put a byte back into the buffer.  Decrement input offset. */
00096 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyBufUngetByte( TidyBuffer* buf, byte bv );
00097 
00098 /** Return the number of bytes readable from the buffer. */
00099 TIDY_EXPORT size_t TIDY_CALL tidyBufLength( TidyBuffer* buf );
00100 
00101 /** Get byte from end of buffer.  Does NOT modify input offset. */
00102 TIDY_EXPORT int TIDY_CALL  tidyBufPeekLastByte( TidyBuffer* buf );
00103 
00104 /** Get byte from front of buffer.  Does NOT modify input offset. */
00105 TIDY_EXPORT int TIDY_CALL  tidyBufPeekByte( TidyBuffer* buf );
00106 
00107 /** 
00108 Get a string from the front of the buffer. The input offset will be incremented.
00109 
00110 @param dst must point to a valid buffer of size @ref dstsize (or larger)
00111 
00112 @param dstsize specifies the maximum number of bytes which will be copied 
00113        from @ref buf to @ref dst, minus 1: the C string sentinel '\0' (NUL) 
00114 
00115 @return Returns the number of bytes copied to @ref dst, without counting the NUL sentinel.
00116 */
00117 TIDY_EXPORT size_t TIDY_CALL tidyBufGetString( TidyBuffer* buf, tmbstr dst, size_t dstsize );
00118

00121    TIDY
00122 **************/
00123 
00124 /* Forward declarations
00125 */
00126 
00127 /** Initialize a buffer input source */
00128 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyInitInputBuffer( TidyInputSource* inp, TidyBuffer* buf );
00129 
00130 /** Initialize a buffer output sink */
00131 TIDY_EXPORT void TIDY_CALL tidyInitOutputBuffer( TidyOutputSink* outp, TidyBuffer* buf );
00132 
00133 #ifdef __cplusplus
00134 }
